public abstract class zeta.session.DefaultAdaptor

(source file: DefaultAdaptor.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.session.DefaultAdaptor
The pure class interface. 
public abstract class DefaultAdaptor
  implements Adaptor
Default Adaptor.

Default adaptor implementation. Gives default (dummy) implementations of most adaptor functions. Function adaptors have to implement the abstract methods getName, getContentType, and tryCompute. Additionally source adaptors have to override the given implementations of isUptodate and lookupUnit. The other methods are overridden as needed.

This class also provides some auxiliar methods methods for diagnostic, error, and progress messages:

Author:
Robert Buessow

Version: $Id: DefaultAdaptor.pizza,v 1.5 2000/05/16 08:10:47 wg Exp $
See also:
sendDiag, sendProgress, sendError

DefaultAdaptor
public DefaultAdaptor();

session
protected Session session;
Holds the session object passed to this adaptor at initialization time.

handle

protected StorageHandle handle;
Holds the storage handle passed to this adaptor at initialization time.

default_locator

public Locator default_locator;
Default locator. Used for diagnostics, if no locator is given.

initialize
public void initialize(Session session,
                       StorageHandle handle);
Initialize adaptor. By default, initializes the session and handle fields. Override, if custom initialization is needed, but note that you either have to call super.initialize(session, handle) or to initialize the session and handle fields by yourself in order to let the generic functionality of this adaptor work.

See also:
initialize

getName

public abstract Name getName();
Adaptor name. Give name of the adaptor as it is used in, e.g., unit names.

See also:
getName

computedTypes

public abstract ContentType[] computedTypes();
Computes content types. Return content types, computed by this adaptor.

See also:
getName

tryCompute

public abstract void tryCompute(Target target)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.ComputationFailed, zeta.session.Failures.CannotCompute;
Try to compute a content. @see Adatpor#tryCompute

flush

public void flush();
Flush persistent data. Override if persistency of data is needed.

See also:
flush

isUptodate

public boolean isUptodate(Target spec,
                          Date definedAt);
Check if content is uptodate. Source adaptors override this method.

See also:
isUptodate

checkExternalData

public void checkExternalData();
Check external data. @see Adaptor#checkExternalData

notifyOutdate

public boolean notifyOutdate(Target target,
                             Date define_at,
                             StorageHandle handle);
Notify outdated. @see Adaptor#notifyOutdate

lookupUnit

public Unit lookupUnit(Name specifier)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.UnresolvableName, zeta.session.Failures.AmbigiousName;
Lookup a unit that does not yes exist in the repository. Overriden by source adaptors.

See also:
lookupUnit

unitLocator

public Locator unitLocator(Unit unit);
Ask the adaptor to return a locator for the given unit.

See also:
unitLocator

sendProgress

public void sendProgress(String msg);
Send progress message.

sendDiag

public void sendDiag(String msg);
Send diagnostic. Sends a diagnostic message to inform the user about errors . Uses the default_locator as locator.

sendWarning

public void sendWarning(String msg);
Send diagnostic. Sends a diagnostic message to inform the user about warnings. Uses the default_locator as locator.

sendError

public void sendError(String msg);
Send diagnostic. Sends a diagnostic message to inform the user about errors. Uses the default_locator as locator.

sendDiag

public void sendDiag(Diag diag);
Send given diagnostic message.

sendDiag

public void sendDiag(Locator locator,
                     Category cat,
                     String msg);
Send diagnostic. Sends a diagnostic message to inform the user about errors and warnings (as given by the error category) that were found at the specificied locator.

sendResult

public void sendResult(String msg);
Sends the result of some computation. Result messages are used by commands to communicate the result of the command execution

public void sendResult(Format fmt);
Sends the result of some computation. Result messages are used by commands to communicate the result of the command execution

public void sendDebug(String msg);
Send debug message.
